noun.description: A statement acknowledging the truth of something.
examples: a tacit admission that things had gone wrong
a man who, by his own admission, fell in love easily

noun.description: The process or fact of entering or being allowed to enter a place, organization, or institution.
examples: the country's admission to the UN
I had some difficulty securing admission to the embassy
her condition required frequent hospital admissions

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin admissio(n-), from the verb admittere (see admit).
